text: 14.103 In addition to this work on gender-inclusivity, as part of the Regulation 18 consultation on the local plan, a disability-focused workshop was co-produced with the disabled peopleâ€™s organization Real. This attracted over 50 participants, who worked together to discuss clusters of questions relating to the local plan themes, and led to a greater understanding of the needs of disabled people within the urban environment. The conclusions from this workshop, along with consultation responses from other groups and individuals representing marginalized communities, has led to the refocusing of this policy towards a more generally inclusive design approach, and an intersectional approach that recognises that people may belong to a combination of marginalised communities based on gender, sexuality, ethnicity, disability and neurodivergence, and age.
